Error Handling
[FCLib API]

Collaboration diagram for Error Handling:

Detailed Description

Data structures and routines to ease error handling.


Defines

#define fc_exitIfError(rc)
 If the return code is an error, print diagnostic and exit.

Define Documentation

#define fc_exitIfError ( rc   ) 

Value:

{ \
    if ( (rc) != FC_SUCCESS ) { \
      fprintf(stderr, "Exiting with error %s (%d) at [%s:%d]\n", \
              fc_getReturnCodeText(rc), (rc), __FILE__, __LINE__);  \
      fflush(NULL); \
      exit(rc); \
    } \
  }
If the return code is an error, print diagnostic and exit.

Description:

This is a helper macro to ease writing command line programs; it groups the test for an error return code with the handling: exit with the same value as the return code.

Example usage: fc_exitIfError(rc) =

"Exiting with error FC_MEMORY_ERROR (-2) at [program.c:276]"

Sometimes this macro has compiling problems if it's used in an if-else block. To fix, surround the call with { }.

Modifications:

  • 05/25/04 WSK Created
  • 11/28/2005 WSD. Added printing of type of error (used to be silent).
